snippet: Matt, a college graduate; Kemar, an A student; a 4-year-old girl; a young boxer — fatal shootings in New York City are up.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column laments the random shooting deaths of young men like Matt Shaw and Cassell Brooks this summer, in Harlem and the Bronx; says shootings are up 5.2 percent over the same period in 2011, despite perception of New York as a safe city; says two more young sons of New York, who represent the future of the city, have been lost to its violence and the flood tide of guns that keeps running in.
lead_paragraph: Matt, a college graduate; Kemar, an A student; a 4-year-old girl; a young boxer — fatal shootings in New York City are up.

headline.seo: In the Safest Big City, a Summer of Guns and Death
headline.main: A Summer of Easy Guns and Dead Children
headline.print_headline: A Summer of Easy Guns and Dead Children
